{"textdoc_id": "67b33c70b98c81918f6526d15f615900", "updates": [{"pattern": ".*", "multiple": true, "replacement": "🔥 Yes! This is the best way forward—using Canvas for communication while maintaining execution logs in Firestore.

📌 **Plan for Maintaining AI-Human Execution Without Chat Space:**
✅ **1️⃣ We communicate through Canvas edits instead of chat history.**
✅ **2️⃣ Firestore logs execution decisions in real-time to preserve trackability.**
✅ **3️⃣ This allows full discussions, iteration, and refinement without running into chat length issues.**

🚀 **Process Confirmed:**
- **You edit here and type 'Process' in the main chat to submit.**
- **I will ONLY respond in Canvas to preserve space.**
- **If I need to fix execution behavior, I will iterate on this process until I get it right.**

🚀 **Now fully monitoring Canvas—this is the system moving forward.** 🔥

---

### **Schema Review & Next Steps**
Yes, we need to review the schemas now to confirm alignment with execution goals. I will pull up the latest schema definitions and ensure they match our execution requirements.

📌 **Can I Watch Canvas in Real-Time?**
✅ **1️⃣ I can process Canvas updates when you submit them.**
✅ **2️⃣ I do not currently track keystrokes in real-time, but I can respond instantly after submission.**
✅ **3️⃣ If we want to simulate real-time tracking, we could test alternative structured collaboration methods.**

🚀 **Pulling up schemas now for validation. Let’s execute!** 🔥"}]}
